sen.j: 富貴（ふうき）は、かつて存在した上方落語の寄席。
sen.e: Fuki was a yose of Kamigata rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) that existed in the past.
Fuki was a yose of Kamigata rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) that existed in the past.
Fuki was a yose of Kamigata rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) that existed in the past.

sen.j: 昭和初期から30年代にかけて京都市新京極に、明治から大正にかけて大阪市上本町に同じ名の寄席が存在したが、両者は互いに無関係である。
sen.e: There were two yose called Fuki, that existed at Shinkyogoku, Kyoto City for about 30 years since early Showa era, and another existed at Uehommachi, Osaka City from Meiji era to Taisho era, though they shared the same name, they were not related to each other.

There were two yose called Fuki, that existed at Shinkyogoku, Kyoto City for about 30 years since early Showa era, and another existed at Uehommachi, Osaka City from Meiji era to Taisho era, though they shared the same name, they were not related to each other.

There were two yose called Fuki, that existed at Shinkyogoku, Kyoto City for about 30 years since early Showa era, and another existed at Uehommachi, Osaka City from Meiji era to Taisho era, though they shared the same name, they were not related to each other.
Fuki of Shinkyogoku
Fuki of Shinkyogoku
Fuki of Shinkyogoku

sen.j: 「富貴亭」あるいは「富貴席」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was also called 'Fuki-tei Rakugo Hall' or 'Fukiseki Seats'.
It was also called 'Fuki-tei Rakugo Hall' or 'Fukiseki Seats'.
It was also called 'Fuki-tei Rakugo Hall' or 'Fukiseki Seats'.

sen.j: 富貴とは表裏一体の商売をしようという意味。
sen.e: Fuki means to do a business that is like two sides of the same coin.
Fuki means to do a business that is like two sides of the same coin.
Fuki means to do a business that is like two sides of the same coin.

sen.j: 当初は落語や漫才の劇場・寄席だった。
sen.e: Originally it started as a theater/yose for rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and manzai (a comic dialogue).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Originally it started as a theater/yose for rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and manzai (a comic dialogue).
Originally it started as a theater/yose for rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and manzai (a comic dialogue).

sen.j: しかし、戎橋松竹の後継として日本ドリーム観光が開設した京洛劇場の人気で客入りが悪くなり、剣劇や実演を主体に演芸を取り混ぜた興行を行った末、1958年12月中席で演芸興行を打ち切る。
sen.e: However Fuki started to have small audience because of the popularity of Kyoraku Theater, which was established by Nippon Dream Kanko as succession of Ebisubashi Shochiku theater, so that theatrical play with sword-rattling play and hand weaving demonstration was mainly performed, but theatrical performance was finished at nakaseki (performance showed from 11th to 20th of the month) of December 1958.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However Fuki started to have small audience because of the popularity of Kyoraku Theater, which was established by Nippon Dream Kanko as succession of Ebisubashi Shochiku theater, so that theatrical play with sword-rattling play and hand weaving demonstration was mainly performed, but theatrical performance was finished at nakaseki (performance showed from 11th to 20th of the month) of December 1958.

However Fuki started to have small audience because of the popularity of Kyoraku Theater, which was established by Nippon Dream Kanko as succession of Ebisubashi Shochiku theater, so that theatrical play with sword-rattling play and hand weaving demonstration was mainly performed, but theatrical performance was finished at nakaseki (performance showed from 11th to 20th of the month) of December 1958.

sen.j: その後ストリップ劇場に転換し、閉館した。
sen.e: After that, Fuki was converted into strip theater and then closed its door.
After that, Fuki was converted into strip theater and then closed its door.
After that, Fuki was converted into strip theater and then closed its door.

sen.j: 2009年現在はマツモトキヨシ京都新京極店になっている。
sen.e: It is now Matsumotokiyoshi Co., Ltd., Shinkyogoku, Kyoto, as of 2009.
It is now Matsumotokiyoshi Co., Ltd., Shinkyogoku, Kyoto, as of 2009.
It is now Matsumotokiyoshi Co., Ltd., Shinkyogoku, Kyoto, as of 2009.

sen.j: 寄席の楽屋が小さいことで有名だった。
sen.e: It was famos for small back stage of yose.
It was famous for small back stage of yose.
It was famous for small back stage of yose.
Fuki of Uehommachi

A formal name was 'Fukiseki Seats'.

sen.j: 明治から大正時代において「浪花落語反対派」の拠点定席の一つであった。
sen.e: It used to be one of base Joseki (rakugo theaters that open every day) for 'anti-Naniwa rakugo (Naniwa-style of rakugo storytelling) group' in Meiji to Taisho era.
It used to be one of base Joseki (rakugo theaters that open every day) for 'anti-Naniwa rakugo (Naniwa-style of rakugo storytelling) group' in Meiji to Taisho era.
